thread.title: VIDEO: Cheetah cub and puppy become best buds at Metro Richmond
thread.title_full: VIDEO: Cheetah cub and puppy become best buds at Metro Richmond - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Shawn Maclauchlan
title: VIDEO: Cheetah cub and puppy become best buds at Metro Richmond
text:
CHESTERFIELD, VA (WWBT) - It sounds like a Disney movie, but the friendship between a cheetah cub and a puppy is real and happening at the Metro Richmond Zoo!
Caretakers say they had to separate Kumbali from his family at two weeks old because he was losing weight - his mom, Khari, was not producing enough milk for her three cubs. They were able to save Kumbali by hand-raising the cub, but reintroducing him to the family at this point was impossible.
"The mother would most likely consider him a threat," Jim Andelin with the Metro Richmond Zoo said.
Male cheetahs are social animals, and now that he was without his family, the zoo needed to find a companion for Kumbali.
They found Kago, a 10-week-old puppy rescued by The Art of Paws from a high-kill shelter, and they quickly became friends.
Click here to see the video on mobile: http://shout.lt/bfhM7
You can visit Kumbali and Kago at the Metro Richmond Zoo, Monday through Thursday from noon to 1 p.m. On Fridays and Saturdays, they will can be seen from noon to 1 p.m. and again from 3 p.m. to 4 p.m.
